009
010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * Scalar version.
017 * This class implements a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter suggested in 
018 * Tomita and Tsuji (1977). It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
019 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
020 * See algorithm 5.2 in Utics Vol. 3.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2021/01/02
024 */
025public class KuwaharaFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements KuwaharaF {
026        
027        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
028        private final int dm;                   // = d-
029        private final int dp;                   // = d+
030        private final float tsigma;
031
032        // constructor using default settings
033        public KuwaharaFilterScalar() {
034                this(new Parameters());
035        }
036        
037        public KuwaharaFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
038                int r = params.radius;
039                this.n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);             // size of complete filter
040                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
041                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
042                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
043        }
044        
045        // ------------------------------------------------------
046
047        private float Smin;             // min. variance
048        private float Amin;                     
049        
050        @Override
051        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
052                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
053                evalSubregionGray(plane, u, v);         // a centered subregion (not in original Kuwahara)
054                Smin = Smin - tsigma * n;                               // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
055                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dm);
056                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dp);
057                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dm);
058                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dp);
059                
060                return Amin;
061        } 
062        
063        // sets the member variables Smin, Amin
064        private void evalSubregionGray(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
065                float S1 = 0; 
066                float S2 = 0;
067                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
068                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {
069                                float a = source.getVal(u+i, v+j);
070                                S1 = S1 + a;
071                                S2 = S2 + a * a;
072                        }
073                }
074//              double s = (sum2 - sum1*sum1/n)/n;      // actual sigma^2
075                float s = S2 - S1 * S1 / n;                     // s = n * sigma^2
076                if (s < Smin) {
077                        Smin = s;
078                        Amin = S1 / n; // mean
079                }
080        }
081}
